tags.name: bayern-atlas
tags.description:
A WebComponent that embeds the BayernAtlas in your page.

## API philosophy

- Attributes are only read initially to declaratively setup the map
- Attributes as well as Getter-Properties reflect the current state of the map
- Use the methods to programmatically change / modify the map

## Coordinates
- The map can take coordinates in both the 4326 and 25832 reference systems (default is 4326)
- The map itself can output coordinates in different reference systems (default is 4326). See `ec_srid` attribute for more information

attributes.name: c
attributes.description: The Center coordinate (longitude,latitude / easting,northing) in `4326` (lon, lat) or in `25832`. Example: `c="11,48"`

attributes.name: z
attributes.description: The Zoom level (0-20) of the map. Example: `z="8"`.

attributes.name: r
attributes.description: The rotation of the map (in rad). Example: `r="0.5"`.

attributes.name: l
attributes.description: The layers of the map. Example: `l="layer_a,layer_b"`.

attributes.name: ec_srid
attributes.description: Designated SRID of returned coordinates (e.g. of geometries). One of `3857`, `4326` , `25832`. Default is `4326`. Example: `ec_srid="25832"`

attributes.name: ec_geometry_format
attributes.description: Designated Type (format) of returned features. One of `ewkt`, `kml`, `geojson`, `gpx`. Default is `ewkt`.  Example: `ec_geometry_format="geoJson"`.

properties.name: id
properties.description: Optional id. If not present, the reducer will create one.

properties.name: center
properties.description: Center coordinate in map projection or in the configured SRID

properties.name: rotation
properties.description: The rotation of the map (in rad)

events.name: baLoad
events.description: Fired when the BayernAtlas is loaded

events.name: baChange
events.description: Fired when the state of the BayernAtlas has changed

events.name: baFeatureSelect
events.description: Fired when one or more features are selected

events.name: baGeometryChange
events.description: Fired when the user creates or modifies a geometry
